An SIS model with standard incidence, density‐dependent logistic deaths and disease‐reduced fertility has the form:
(4)
where r= b− m > 0 ( Hethcote et al. [2005]). The density‐dependent term affects only deaths. Infectious animals have reduced fertility by a factor f, 0 ≤ f≤ 1. Assuming S(0) = S 0≈ N= K, the basic reproduction number for model ( 4) is
The reduction in fertility does not affect the basic reproduction number. Hethcote et al. [2005] show that with standard incidence and , the disease cannot persist, lim
t→∞
I( t) = 0. However, if , either the population reaches an enzootic equilibrium with the population reduced in density or the population does not survive.
